movies.title: The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High
movies.plot: A high school jock bets his friends that he can score with the school beauty queen, who is also a virgin.
movies.simplePlot: A high school jock bets his friends that he can score with the school beauty queen, who is also a virgin.

biography.bio: Joseph R. Straface is an actor, known for The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High (1987) and The Inner Voice (1995).
biography.name: Joseph R. Straface

biography.bio: Stacy Christensen was born on November 28, 1969. She is an actress and assistant director, known for The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High (1987), Turbulences (1987) and Soledad (2000).
biography.name: Stacy Christensen

biography.bio: J.T. Wotton was born as John Tyler Wotton. He is known for his work on Shanghai Noon (2000), The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford (2007) and The Claim (2000).
biography.name: J.T. Wotton

biography.bio: Anna Lisa Iapaolo was born in Toronto, Canada. She is an actress, known for The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High (1987).
biography.name: Anna Lisa Iapaolo

biography.bio: Lee Barringer was born on February 7, 1968 in Brighton, England. He is an actor, known for The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High (1987) and The Inner Voice (1995).
biography.name: Lee Barringer

biography.bio: Bev Wotton is known for her work on The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High (1987), Rad (1986) and Now & Forever (2002).
biography.name: Bev Wotton

biography.name: Tara Wilder

biography.bio: Barry Allan Onody has always had a passion for acting and entertaining, he is a natural story teller and jokester with an ability to make everyone feel at ease. Laughter is always in the air when Barry is in the room. It surfaced in his youth where he was raised in southern Alberta, Canada. People always looked forward to seeing Barry, his early years in 4H clubs he entertained with his endless repertoire of jokes. Later into his rodeo years with his Dad the natural entertainer shown through. So of course he was drawn like a moth to a flame when it came to theatre arts in high school. College and on into his professional life, the acting bug kept urging him to study the craft and pursue his interest in film and television. While in Calgary attending acting classes he met his wife, and trained with Judy Kerr in Los Angeles. Barry went on to have a successful career in commercials in Canada, while adding in small movie roles. His priority changed for a few years, to providing for his growing family, but his fingers were always in some sort of local theatre production. Acting finally lead him to Los Angeles where he now dedicates more time pursing his acting passion. His latest role was the lead for National Geographic's "Locked Up Abroad" series titled "Vegas Mobster" where he portrayed real life mobster "Frank Cullotta".
biography.name: Barry Onody
